security: Releasing names of former employees could reveal their past association with the Agency, potentially endangering them or compromising sensitive operations. The cable states, 'THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE OF THE RELATIONSHIP OF YOUR TRUE NAME AND THE AGENCY WILL HAVE TO BE LOOKED AT CAREFULLY TO DETERMINE THE VIABILITY OF CONTINUED COVER PROTECTION.'
summary: This cable from March 1997 directs the Bonn station to contact a former employee residing in Wachtberg-Pech, Germany, to inform them that their name appears in JFK Assassination Records and provide guidance on potential release of their name to the public under the JFK Records Collection Act of 1992.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 7, 1997, a SECRET cable was sent from the Chief/OCC to the Bonn station requesting assistance in contacting a former employee in Wachtberg-Pech, Germany. The purpose of this contact is to inform the former employee that their name appears in documents being reviewed for public release under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992. The cable provides the text of a letter to be delivered, explaining the implications of the Act, the potential release of their name, the grounds for postponement of public disclosure, and contact information for Beth Mills at headquarters, as well as answers to frequently asked questions.
title: Request for Station Assistance: JFK Assassination Records Act
